summary: An email from the U.S. Marshals Service detailing the strict custody restrictions and monitoring procedures for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack County Department of Corrections, including her housing, observation schedule, and authorized communication with her attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The high-profile inmate subject to strict custody restrictions at Merrimack County Department of Corrections, authorized to communicate only with her legal counsel.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's authorized legal counsel, with whom she is permitted to communicate after he provides the appropriate PIN.

connections.description: Maxwell is authorized to communicate only with her legal counsel, Lawrence Vogelman, under strict security protocols.

events.title: Documentation delivery deadline
events.description: Supervisors are directed to deliver documentation and video footage from Maxwell's monitoring to an unspecified recipient.

locations: Merrimack County Department of Corrections (Merrimack DOC)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at Merrimack County Department of Corrections under extremely high-security restrictions due to her high-profile status.
She was to be housed in a medical isolation cell (MI) with SRT (Special Response Team) personnel posted and relieved only by other SRT personnel.
Maxwell was placed on a 15-minute observation watch, with all rounds and touch probe rounds documented in a system called )(Jail.
She was authorized to communicate only with her legal counsel, Lawrence Vogelman, after he provided the appropriate PIN.
Staff were explicitly prohibited from making statements to the press regarding Maxwell or the standard operating procedures for her custody.
